title: Well done
comment: Works great for me. It's well thought out and comprehensive. My guess is that some of the bad ratings came from an earlier version. I tried a number of similar apps and this one was best.

title: Not safe yet!
comment: Keeps going off, no prompt.  Also knocked out my Nova launcher and took me back to default Android layout until after I checked my apps list, then the launcher returned.

title: Keeps going off
comment: Going on panic mode without anything

title: POOR
comment: I had not touched the phone and it sent my emergency contacts TWENTY TWO messages and had people searching all over for me. This is unnecessary stress. Deleted.

title: Works Like a Charm!
comment: This is THE ONLY practical app out there thanks to the power button module. I wouldn't imagine having the luxury of opening an app to press some button. Its far more practical to simply feel the power button to send alert. I'm definitely introducing this app to our housing community that features some 1000+ households.

title: Utilissimo
comment: Funzionale e semplice.solo qualche piccolo bug.consigliato.

title: Gօօɖ
comment: Gօօɖ. Nօt ɮaɖ😊😊

title: Auto-activated today. Uninstalled.
comment: Sent my family into a panic today when this auto-activated. No thank you!

title: Random activation
comment: Randomly activated 100s of times filling up the mobile phones of my lawyer, colleagues,  my journalism safety partners, and security personnel. Intelligence agencies in my home country sent out an armed emergency protection detail to make sure I am safe, when I am chilling with friends. In last two days, has sent over 350 messages across the planet :$300 of sms. Are you going to pay this poor human rights journalist's phone bill? Every tap of power button (not long press) sends. HTC One M8, 4.4.3 kitkat

title: Don't waste your money or time
comment: It has no option to change settings,  to deactivate the app or change the person you are notifying.  It triggers each time you press the power button or when you get a call. The so called deactivation description is useless.

title: Excellent concept but...
comment: App works great in principle,however its still somrwhat buggy.. it seems to off by itself when someone is accesing gps data, fot ex when calling customer setvice at bank....

title: Keeps sending
comment: Keeps sending alerts from my sgs5.  Phone locked I pocket and sent 12 alerts in 15 minutes
Good for help

title: Can't stop sanding
comment: Program continues sending sms even after I switched to ready to send mode. Sometimes accidentally activates when I answer the phone. N7000.

Thanks for your feedback, I’m very sorry about the inconvenience. We realise it wasn't clear enough that the app will send messages every 5 minutes until it's deactivated. This is a security feature and we've updated the app description with further deactivation instructions. You can email to let us know what you think at support@panicbutton.io.

title: Brilliant
comment: Simple and very effective,

title: Randomly activates
comment: The app has repeatedly activated itself. It is possible this is due to the power button being pressed by accident - but can't be sure. Perhaps an option to disable or customise the activation would help. Meanwhile the alerts racked up a huge roaming bill as it took a few days (1 minute interval) to realise that the app was activated and the messages were sent to a disused international number.

Hi Benjamin, Thanks so much for your feedback, and I'm so sorry for any trouble. Could you please drop us an email to support@panicbutton.io to let us know what model and version of phone you were using & version of Android, and possibly let us know a bit more about what happened, how many messages were sent and when? Thanks so much for your help.

title: Random Alerts
comment: The App would frequently start sending alerts without being triggered. It seemed to happen when was on the phone during a call. Particularly if I were going through a prompt menu.. I.E. cell phone provider or cable provider. I uninstalled and reinstalled twice. I double and triple checked all of the settings. The app worked as decribed when tested, however would randomly send out alerts, as well. Essentially the app was "crying wolf" which, as you can imagine,caused issues. I use a Galaxy S3.

Hi Tomi, thanks for your feedback, & sorry you've had these problems. We're working on fixing these bugs and it would be helpful if you could email us at support@panicbutton.io to tell us the version of Android you're using, and if there were other apps installed that might interfere with the Panic Button? And any other useful info. Thanks so much!
Far too easy to accidentally activate via power button. No option to customise alert method.

title: Sandra
comment: Good

title: Good idea but there are issues
comment: I had to remove it because of false alarms, it's too sensitive.

Hi Ben Thanks so much for your feedback, and sorry if it caused you any inconvenience. Can you please let us know what exactly was triggering the alert, or what happened before the messages sent? Also, details of your phone and version of Android would help. You can email us at support@panicbutton.io, with details. Thanks a lot for your help.

title: Wouldn't work on Nexus 5
comment: Sounds like a pretty good idea.  After installing tested with one contact but would never receive  alerts. Finally uninstalled.

Hi Carlos, I'm sorry to hear that you had this problem, but thanks for the feedback. To help us understand what happened would you please be able to email us at support@panicbutton.io and tell us your phone make, and version of Android, as well as any error messages, or any apps that are installed that could interfere with Panic Button? Thank you.

title: Cool app,  but not 100%
comment: I install this on my mom's phone in cause she ever needs help (she's not tech savvy and can't speak English), but something is triggering the alert (tried on 3 phones). As it right now,  the app is pointless because after so many accidental alerts,  the  receiver will just ignore it. Please fix and add a lockscreen way of activating it. Thanks

Hi Gary, very sorry about this but thanks for your feedback. We're working on some fixes, and we've clarified the deactivation instructions in the app description. To improve our data, if you could send us more info (phone type/android version, when/how often the alerts were triggered) at support@panicbutton.io, that would be great. Thanks so much.

title: Sends false warnings and can't stop it without uninstalling
comment: Good idea, but today it decided to text my contacts incessantly and I couldn't figure out how to stop the texts without uninstalling the app. Problem#1: I didn't set off the panic alarm so I don't know what set the app off. My phone screen was off, and I didn't press the power button at all. Problem#2: Even if I was in danger, it seems the app is set up to text your contacts every few minutes. It's overkill and seems like more of an annoyance to my contacts than being helpful.

HI Cristina, thanks so much for feedback & sorry for this inconvenience. The message should send every 5 minutes with GPS updates, but we've clarified the deactivation instructions in the app description. Could you please send us a bit more info at support@panicbutton.io re false activation (any buttons pressed, what happened beforehand)? Thanks!

title: Couldn't open settings
comment: And it sent alarms to my contacts

Hi Samantha, Thanks for letting us know this, and very sorry for any trouble caused. We've updated the app description with instructions on how to get to settings and deactivate the alarm. I hope this is helpful and you can let us know what you think or report any other problems at support@panicbutton.io. Many thanks
Too easy to set off

title: POOR
comment: It keeps spamming my three contacts with my GPS location even after deleting the app. how the f..ck i can stop it sending sms!!!!!!!! keeping any number in the calculator pressed and later my PIN?? YOU SHOULD EXPLAIN THIS IN THE DESCRIPTION OR CONTINUE GETTING 1 STAR RATINGS...

Hi, thanks a lot for letting us know this and sorry for the problems you've had. We've updated the app description with details of how to deactivate and uninstall the app, and you can let us know what you think at support@panicbutton.io. Thanks!

title: Fail
comment: Instructions for turning off are inadequate. Enter settings to turn off app exactly how?  Tried a number of different ways, and none of them worked. Meanwhile my contacts are getting notices that I'm in trouble.

Hi Michael, Thanks for your review, I’m very sorry that you've had problems with deactivation. We have updated the app description with clearer deactivation instructions, and we have plans to provide clearer instructions in the app. You can email to let us know what you think, or if you have any further problems, at support@panicbutton.io.

title: Good Idea, Poor Implementation
comment: This Panic Button would be great if it worked properly. Instead, it has gone of twice now in as many days when I hadn't so much as touched my phone. I'm not sure if it's a problem with the application or the phone hardware, but I've scared my Dad too many times now.

Hi Lucas, I'm sorry that you've had this problem but thanks for your review. Feedback is very helpful! We're working through some fixes and it would be useful if you could contact us at support@panicbutton.io with details of what phone and version of Android you are using, as well as what happened when the alert was triggered. Thanks again!

title: Power Button Problem
comment: While setting up the system, it says to test by repeatedly pressing your power button. My problem is that system does not work for the Note 3. Instead, my phone has a menu for shutdown options. If I could skip using the power button method, this app would be helpful.

title: Great idea..
comment: However, today it just sent my contactperson notifications by itself (did not touch the app nor my phone) and the messages are still flooding in. Not sure how to stop it, will try reinstalling for now.

Hi, very sorry for this & thanks for your feedback. We're working on solving problems & I've updated description to clarify the alert will send every 5 minutes & that in some cases it's getting accidentally triggered (with deactivation instructions). You can let us know what you think/ provide more details of what happened at support@panicbutton.io

title: Not good
comment: I sent one alert to test it and it kept sending messages all night long, and although that is good in case of an emergency, I should have been able to turn off the alerts too if I wanted to..

Hi Liliana Thanks for your feedback, I’m very very sorry about the inconvenience. We realise it wasn't clear  that the app will send messages every 5 minutes until it's deactivated. This is a security feature and we've updated the app description to make it clearer how to deactivate. You can let us know what you think at support@panicbutton.io.

title: Poor
comment: It keeps spamming my three contacts with my GPS location even after deleting the app.

Hi, thank you for the review, I'm very sorry you had this problem. If you could contact us at support@panicbutton.io with details (Android version, what happened before it started sending messages, what your contacts received etc) it would be great. We've also updated the app description with more info on features and deactivation. Thanks a lot!

title: Install not smooth
comment: Doesn't detect successful Power Button test when returning to app. Need a skip test button (perhaps saying - Not Recommended) but at least it would let me continue setup - or separate testing from first time setup. This did not occur with 1.28 on F-Droid repository - only 1.30 on Play?

title: Very useful for app for the activists
comment: Glad Amnesty International did this

title: Some issues...
comment: Developer responded quickly and pointed out the issues I experienced are due to Android 4.4 and they are resolving them, great!  -- Just installed and tested the application, there is some odd behaviour:  - Sent SMS messages can be found in the Messaging app. This pretty much defeats the purpose of trying to have the app as stealthy as possible.  - After setting up the application and launching a panic, I find myself in a launcher that is not my own (I use Nova Launcher, am assuming I'm seeing the default after opening the app). Hitting the home button a bunch of times resolved this.   Details of my phone & os available upon request.

Hi Menso,

Thanks a lot for the valuable feedback. The API changed on Android 4.4 for SMS Sent Items. I've captured the issue on our tracker and also added a notice and link on the Release notes (https://github.com/iilab/PanicButton/releases/tag/v1.3.0). I'll get in touch directly about the launcher problem. Stay tuned for a new release!

Jun

title: Ushahidi
comment: this app could be far more better if they could mix it with Ushahidi system
